Key Match Events: Sesinyi (52') scored the only goal for Botswana in a 1-0 win over Cape Verde
Johnson (2'), Ramotse (22'), Seakanyeng (79'), Kebatho (80') scored for Botswana in the first match
Arcanjo (70') scored for Cape Verde in the first match
Pre-Game Insights: Botswana will look to secure consecutive wins for the first time since July 2023 and move into second place in Group C
Cape Verde head into Tuesday's clash on a run of four defeats in their last six matches across all competitions
Post-Match Reflections: Botswana got their quest for a place in Morocco up and running on Thursday as they picked up a 2-0 victory over Cape Verde when the two nations squared off at the Estadio Nacional de Cabo Verde
This was a much-needed result for Didier Gomes Da Rosa's men, who had failed to win any of their previous four matches
Miscellaneous Highlights: Botswana and Cape Verde return to action in the 2025 Africa Cup of Nations qualifiers when they lock horns in the second of their October double-header on Tuesday
The two teams will face each other again on October 15, 2024, at the Francistown Stadium
Others: Botswana are currently 147th in the latest FIFA World Rankings
Cape Verde have managed just three points from their opening three matches
